monster.name: Decrepit Skeleton
languages: understands all languages it knew in life but can't speak

trait.name: Minion
entries: If the creature takes damage from an attack or as the result of a failed saving throw, its hit points are reduced to 0. If the creature takes damage from another effect, it dies if the damage equals or exceeds its hit point maximum, otherwise it takes no damage.

trait.name: Bone Dust Burst
entries: When the skeleton dies, it explodes in a cloud of dust, heavily obscuring the area in a 5 ft. radius around itself for the next minute, or until cleared away by a strong wind.

action.name: Rusted Blade (Group Attack)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}2 slashing damage. On a roll of 1, the blade breaks and becomes unusable.

reaction.name: Hate the Living
entries: As a reaction when a creature the skeleton can see reduces an undead ally of the skeleton's to 0 hit points, the skeleton moves up to 10 ft. towards the creature.

After decades of research by physicians, telepaths, philosophers, and necromancers, this is the conclusion that has been reached: Your skeleton is alive, and it hates you. A skeleton's life is one of torment, trapped in a prison of flesh whose life it is shackled to and sustained by.
Ordinarily skeletons die with their hosts, but due to powerful ambient magic, necromantic ritual, or liberation by another skeleton can rise as free creatures in undeath.

entries.name: Arcana DC 10:
entries: Skeletons, unlike most simple undead, are not entirely mindless, and retain the ability to follow complex orders, even sometimes displaying or acquiring skills they lacked in life.

entries.name: Arcana DC 15:
entries: While sponaneous undeath does occasionally happen due to powerful ambient negative energies, it seems to happen in epidemics with skeletons. Where one skeleton in a barrow arises, soon every skeleton will.

entries.name: Intelligence (Athletics) DC 10:
entries: Despite their murderous intent, ultimately skeletons are kind of just people with no muscles. They are easily shoved around, and a single well placed strike with a bone-breaking weapon such as a cosh or hammer is often enough to neutralize one.

entries.name: Nature DC 20:
entries: Though the principle is still the subject of some controversy, it is now thought in many academic circles that all skeletons are independant, intelligent beings, living in symbiosis with the creatures they inhabit.
If nothing else, this helps to explain the mysterious ease with which a necromancer may independantly animate the flesh and bones of a creature.

entries.name: Skeleton Tactics
entries: Skeletons typically begin combat by targeting the nearest living creature with ranged or melee attacks, but on subsequent turns prioritize as a target anyone who destroyed a skeleton in the last turn. They are easily lured into traps as they cannot easily perceive nonliving things, but usually will not provoke attacks of opportunity with their Hate the Living reaction.

monster.name: Skeleton Warrior
languages: understands all languages it knew in life but can't speak

trait.name: Unliving Warriors
entries: The skeleton has proficiency in all martial weapons and armor.

trait.name: Bonesense
entries: The skeleton can pinpoint, by scent, the location of any creature with bones within 20 ft. of it, and does not suffer disadvantage for attacking a creature with bones that it cannot see.

trait.name: Rattle
entries: A creature that hits the skeleton with a melee attack that deals bludgeoning damage must succeed a {@dc 12} Wisdom saving throw or be Frightened until the end of its next turn as it feels its own skeleton twitch slightly.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Shortbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Marrowseal
entries: If the skeleton would receive any magical healing, it receives no healing, and instead loses the ability to use its Boneshard for the next minute.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The skeleton makes two attacks with its bound blades, one of which it may replace with a use of its Boneshard.

action.name: Bound Blades
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Boneshard
entries: One creature the skeleton can see within 20 ft. must make a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, the target takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) piercing damage and has its movement speed reduced by 5 ft. until a creature takes an action to remove the shard, or takes half as much damage on a success.

reaction.name: Boneshard Burst
entries: When the skeleton drops to 0 hit points, it may use its reaction to use its Boneshard against each creature within 10 ft. before being destroyed.

monster.name: Blazing Bones
languages: understands all languages it knew in life but can't speak

trait.name: Bonesense
entries: The skeleton can pinpoint, by scent, the location of any creature with bones within 20 ft. of it, and does not suffer disadvantage for attacking a creature with bones that it cannot see.

trait.name: Burning Aura
entries: A creature that starts its turn within 5 ft. of the blazing bones or hits it with a melee attack takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) fire damage.

trait.name: Regrow Nerves
entries: If the blazing bones would receive any magical healing, it receives no healing, and instead gains disadvantage on attack rolls for the next minute.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The blazing bones makes two attacks with its blazing claw.

action.name: Blazing Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@dice 1d6 + 3}) slashing plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) fire damage.

action.name: Hurled Flame
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 30 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d10 + 3}) fire damage and the creature catches flame; until a creature takes an action to douse the fire, the creature takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) fire damage at the start of each of its turns.

entries: Blazing bones are created when a creature that burned to death spontaneously arises. They experience incredible pain if exposed to healing magic.

monster.name: Skeletal Tomb Guard
languages: understands all languages it knew in life but can't speak

trait.name: Bonesense
entries: The tomb guard can pinpoint, by scent, the location of any creature with bones within 20 ft. of it, and does not suffer disadvantage for attacking a creature with bones that it cannot see.

trait.name: Rattle
entries: A creature that hits the tomb guard with a melee attack that deals bludgeoning damage must succeed a {@dc 12} Wisdom saving throw or be Frightened until the end of its next turn as it feels its own skeleton twitch slightly.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The tomb guard makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Ancient Blade
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@dice 1d6 + 4}) piercing plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Cascade of Steel {@recharge 5}
entries: The tomb guard makes four melee attacks. If all of them miss, the tomb guard falls {@condition prone} and ends its turn.

reaction.name: Parrying Flurry
entries: As a reaction to being targeted with a melee attack by a creature it can see, the tomb guard raises its AC by 2 against the triggering attack. If this causes the attack to miss, the tomb guard regains its reaction.

entries.name: Skeletal Tomb Guard Tactics
entries: If supported by allied skeletons, the tomb guard saves its cascade of steel until one of them is destroyed, targeting the last creature to destroy one, afterwards using it whenever available. It uses its Parrying Flurry against every attack for as long as it keeps working.

languages: understands all languages it knew in life but can't speak

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The skeletal champion makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Fleshstripper Blade
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@dice 1d8 + 3}) slashing plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) necrotic damage. On a critical hit, the target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw or fall {@condition prone} as its bones spasm within its body.

action.name: Wake the Bones {@recharge 5}
entries: One creature within 30 feet that the skeleton can see must succeed on a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or have its skeleton rattle within its flesh, taking 21 ({@dice 6d6}) points of bludgeoning damage and being dragged up to 10 feet in a direction of the skeleton's choice on a failure, or taking half as much damage on a success.
An creature with 0 hit points that fails this save dies. At the begining of its following turn, the creature's skeleton tears itself out of the creature's body, acting on the creature's initiative.

reaction.name: Dark Martyr
entries: When the skeleton drops to 0 hit points, it may use its reaction to use its Wake the Bones against an {@condition unconscious} creature within range before being destroyed, if available.

entries.name: History DC 20:
entries: There are occasional stories of whole villages disappearing overnight, their bones tearing free leaving piles of loose flesh behind. Rumors are spoken in hushed voices of a spontaneously arisen, free-willed skeleton that can awaken other skeletons.

entries.name: Skeletal Liberator Tactics
entries: Skeletal Liberators use their Wake the Bones if they have an unconscious target or one they can drag into a hazard, otherwise preferring to use their Fleshstripper Blade. If it has fewer than 35 hit points, it saves its reaction for Dark Martyr.

monster.name: Bonecrusher Skeleton
languages: understands all languages it knew in life but can't speak

trait.name: Bonesense
entries: The skeleton can pinpoint, by scent, the location of any creature with bones within 20 ft. of it, and does not suffer disadvantage for attacking a creature with bones that it cannot see.

trait.name: Huge Stature
entries: A creature adjacent to the skeleton may spend half of its movement to attempt a {@dc 13} Strength (Athletics) check. On a success, the creature climbs onto the skeleton. While climbing on the skeleton, a creature has advantage on melee attacks against the skeleton, and the skeleton has disadvantage on melee attacks against it.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The skeleton makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Crushing Maul
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 3d8 + 5}) bludgeoning damage.
Each other creature within 5 feet of the target must succeed on a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw or take half the attack's damage.

action.name: Claw Snatch
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) bludgeoning damage and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 16}).

action.name: Ragdoll Smash {@recharge 5}
entries: The skeleton repeatedly slams a {@condition grappled} creature into the ground, forcing it to succeed on a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or take 36 ({@damage 8d8}) bludgeoning damage and be Stunned until the end of the giants next trn, or take half as much damage on a success.

entries.name: Arcana DC 15:
entries: Bonecrusher is a term variously used for the reanimated skeletons of ogres and giants, though the name is often quite apt, as bonecrushers often lack the reticence that some other skeletons seem to show toward wielding bludgeoning weapons.

entries.name: History DC 15:
entries: Despite their undeniable utility, bonecrushers are rarely employed by necromancers on any but an extremely short term basis, as a giant clan that catches word of their dead being defiled will stop at nothing to repay the insult.

entries.name: Bonecrusher Skeleton Tactics
entries: Bonecrusher skeletons open with their Crushing Maul, swinging at the tightest concentration of foes. Once its enemies begin to spread out, it swaps out one of its attacks with it claw snatch, then on the following turn uses its ragdoll smash.
